Traffic Separation Scheme (TSS) applicability in coastal waters of Skåne County, Sweden; spatial anchor near Trelleborg
Operational Protocol Rationale: Passenger vessels operating under engine power in this region typically follow structured maritime routes due to navigational constraints and traffic management protocols. The observed stable speed, gradual course adjustment, and minimal heading variation are characteristic of vessels navigating gently curving coastal channels or designated shipping lanes, such as those connecting Trelleborg to Klaipėda. This behavior reflects standard operating procedures for ferries or cruise ships transiting busy Baltic Sea routes, where predictable motion ensures collision avoidance and compliance with local traffic patterns. Although linear navigation occurs elsewhere, the combination of vessel size, route geometry, and proximity to port areas makes a smoothly turning trajectory more plausible than straight-line movement, particularly when traversing known bends in regulated waterways.
